title: Direct Imaging of Lithiation-induced Phase Transition in Epitaxial T-Nb2O5 Thin Flims Anode under Electric Fields by In-situ STEM
content: Nb2O5 is a unique oxide exhibiting various polymorphs which are stabilized over a wide temperature range, such as pseudo-hexagonal TT-Nb2O5, orthorhombic T-Nb2O5, monoclinic B-Nb2O5, monoclinic H-Nb2O5 in the order of increasing temperature. Nb2O5 has been studied extensively for various applications such as lithium-ion batteries and electrochemical hydrogenation catalysts [1-3]. Among various polymorphs, T-Nb2O5 has attracted much interests due to its capability of fast ion conduction along the 4g atomic layer channels [4]. In view from the crystal structure, it is expected that the 4g atomic layers are oriented straight vertically when T-Nb2O5 phase is grown along the [180] direction. Recently, a (180)-oriented epitaxial T-Nb2O5 film has been grown successfully and demonstrated to exhibit nonvolatile electronic properties during reversible ionic gating [5]. In this regard, a (180)-oriented single domainT-Nb2O5 film can serve as a good model system to study fundamental Li ion transport mechanisms but has not been reported yet.
